page.title: 14MEMORIES S.HEDINGHAM
page.content: On June 3rd we went to the{Old} {Peoples}home in Sible Hedingham.{Mrs} {Ranner}said she worked at Courtaulds Silk Factory from 6.00am till 4.30pm. {Mrs. Springett}went to our school more than 70 years ago. The Headmaster and Headmistress were Mr.and Mrs. Robinson. At school two children had a small plot and they planted cabbages. {Mrs. Flint}lived in Alderford Street in an old cottage, which only had an outside toilet and that was only a bucket. The old Mill in Alderford Street was owned by Mr. Rollingson. The{Webster sisters}had an open Landau Carriage to drive around in. The games they used to play were Netball,Hopscotch,Spinning Tops,Hide and Seek,Skipping and Blackberry. There were no doorstep deliveries, people had to walk to the nearest shop
